intro: Quercus schulzei, commonly known as the Mexican white oak, is a deciduous tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The tree is characterized by its white to pale gray bark and its alternate, simple, ovate leaves with a serrated margin. It produces small, cup-shaped acorns that are typically covered in a dense, hairy cap. Quercus schulzei is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
